sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Tuesday posted a 32% rise in fourth quarter earnings, beating analyst estimates, and offered a solid 2012 forecast.
The Atlanta-based company reported fourth quarter net income of $774 million, or 50 cents per share, compared with $587 million, or 36 cents per share, in the year-ago period.
Revenue rose 6% from last year to $16.01 billion.
On average, Wall Street analysts expected a much smaller profit of 42 cents per share on lower revenue of $15.5 billion.
Looking ahead, HD forecast 2012 full-year earnings of $2.79 per share on revenue of $73.2 billion, while analysts are looking for $2.76 per share on $72.47 billion in revenue.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.48% dividend yield, based on Friday's closing stock price of $46.71.
The stock has technical support in the $42 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $50-$52 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
